excerpt: This large, sandy beach on a bay is surrounded by trees & is a popular spot for surfing.
detail_description: Cox Bay Beach is a popular spot for surfing and offers a large sandy area surrounded by trees. It is known for its spectacular views, especially during sunset. Visitors can also explore Pettinger Point for panoramic vistas of Cox Bay, Rosie Bay, and Chesterman Beach. The Cedar-shingled Long Beach Lodge Resort provides luxurious accommodation with ocean views and a farm-to-table menu. Additionally, there is a moderate out-and-back trail offering endless views of Cox Bay and the surrounding area.
name: Cox Bay Beach
address: Alberni-Clayoquot, BC, Canada

excerpt: This scenic beach with soft sand & sunset views is a popular surfing destination.
detail_description: Chesterman Beach is a picturesque coastal destination renowned for its soft sand and breathtaking sunsets. This sandy beach boasts a lengthy, magnificent shoreline that curves into a charming heart shape, making it a vibrant spot for families and outdoor enthusiasts in Tofino. Visitors can enjoy the soothing sound of waves while observing the diverse wildlife, including shorebirds, whales, osprey, and otters native to the Pacific West Coast.
name: Chesterman Beach
address: Tofino, BC, Canada

excerpt: Tofino is a small district on Vancouver Island, off Canada's west coast. It sprawls on a peninsula within Clayoquot Sound, characterised by wild natural scenery including lakes, inlets and ancient rainforest. Sandy beaches with year-round surfing facilities include Cox Bay, Chesterman Beach and popular Long Beach, part of the Pacific Rim National Park Reserve. The relaxed town of Tofino sits on the peninsula's tip.
detail_description: Tofino, a charming district nestled on Vancouver Island's west coast, is a paradise for nature lovers and adventure seekers alike. This picturesque town sits at the tip of a peninsula in Clayoquot Sound, surrounded by breathtaking landscapes featuring ancient rainforests, serene lakes, and stunning inlets. With its sandy beaches like Cox Bay and Long Beach—part of the Pacific Rim National Park Reserve—Tofino is renowned for year-round surfing opportunities that cater to all skill levels.
name: Tofino
address: British Columbia V0R 2Z0, Canada

detail_description: Tacofino, a renowned food truck in Tofino, gained popularity since its establishment in 2009. Located at the back of the Live To Surf Parking Lot, this vibrant orange truck continues to attract both locals and tourists. Offering an array of mouth-watering tacos, burritos, and gringas (with vegan and vegetarian options available), Tacofino is a must-visit destination. Some menu favorites include the Tuna Ta Taco, Fish Taco, and Krispy Chicken Taco.
name: Tacofino
address: 1184 Pacific Rim Hwy, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

excerpt: Sea-view restaurant with a warm, rustic vibe serving creative locally sourced plates & cocktails.
detail_description: Wolf in the Fog is a charming sea-view eatery with a cozy, rustic atmosphere that offers innovative dishes and cocktails made from locally sourced ingredients. This popular restaurant not only captivates diners with its exquisite food, but also impresses with its stunning decor and ambiance. It is worth noting that Wolf in the Fog caters to families, as it provides a kids menu for younger guests.
name: Wolf in the Fog
address: 150 Fourth St, Tofino, BC V0R 3A0, Canada

detail_description: Situated on the serene and picturesque Mackenzie beach in Clayoquot Sound, British Columbia, the BEST WESTERN Tin Wis Resort Lodge provides ideal accommodations. Nature enthusiasts will thrive in this area, as it offers outstanding opportunities for hiking, deep-sea fishing, paddle boarding, surfing, hot springs bathing, canoeing, and kayaking. One can also partake in guided wilderness tours to witness majestic whales and bears.
name: Mackenzie Beach
address: Hellesen Dr, Tofino, BC, Canada

excerpt: Contemporary timber house with a patio serving elevated bistro fare sourced from local purveyors.
detail_description: Shelter Restaurant is a modern wooden house with a charming outdoor patio that offers elevated bistro cuisine made from local ingredients. Regardless of the weather in Tofino, this bustling restaurant ensures all your needs are met. Their menu features a variety of dishes ranging from seafood delicacies to more casual options.
name: Shelter Restaurant
address: 634 Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

excerpt: Easygoing spot offering inventive donuts, sandwiches & salads, plus pizza at diner.
detail_description: Rhino Coffee House, a laid-back establishment in Tofino, offers innovative pastries, sandwiches, and salads. They also serve pizza at their diner. Since its opening in 2013, Rhino Coffee has been dedicated to brewing fresh coffee and baking donuts daily. While they provide delivery services for their locally roasted coffee beans across British Columbia, experiencing Rhino's renowned all-day breakfast and homemade wraps requires being present at their physical location.
name: Rhino Coffee House
address: 430 Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

excerpt: High-end oceanfront property offering stylish rooms & cottages, plus dining & a surf school.
detail_description: Long Beach Lodge Resort is a high-end oceanfront property on Vancouver Island's wild and stunning west coast. It offers stylish rooms and cottages with splendid furnishings, including fireplaces and wood accents. The resort pays attention to customers' preferences, providing cozy sitting arrangements that create a homely feeling. Guests can enjoy beautiful views of the ocean waves or watch surfers in Cox Bay while reading a book by the window or in front of the massive fireplace.
name: Long Beach Lodge Resort
address: 1441 Pacific Rim Hwy, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

detail_description: The Roy Henry Vickers Gallery is a must-visit for art enthusiasts and history lovers alike. This traditional Northwest Coast longhouse, adorned with intricate carvings and totem poles, showcases the vibrant and evocative artwork of renowned First Nations artist Roy Henry Vickers. Visitors can explore his distinctive pieces inspired by the Pacific Northwest Coast, reflecting Indigenous culture and spirituality.
name: Roy Henry Vickers Gallery
address: 350 Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

excerpt: Warm, relaxed stop serving burgers, healthy bowls & brews plus year-round patio seating & take-out.
detail_description: The Shed is a welcoming and relaxed eatery in Tofino, Canada that specializes in serving nourishing bowls, beverages, and unique burgers. It boasts a pleasant outdoor seating area that remains available all year round. This highly regarded restaurant prioritizes sustainability by sourcing its beef, chicken, and pork from local farms on Vancouver Island and throughout British Columbia. Situated in downtown Tofino, The Shed provides a warm West Coast ambiance while offering superb dining options for families and friends alike.
name: Shed
address: 461 Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

detail_description: Naa'Waya'Sum Gardens, formerly known as the Tofino Botanical Gardens, is a serene and whimsical destination for nature enthusiasts. The 12-acre site offers boardwalked hiking trails through lush greenery and along the shoreline. Visitors can admire an impressive sculpture collection, including pieces with objects washed ashore from the 2011 Japanese tsunami. Guided tours by local experts provide insights into the Indigenous perspective of the surrounding forest.
name: Naa'Waya'Sum Gardens (formerly the Tofino Botanical Gardens)
address: 1084 Pacific Rim Hwy, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

detail_description: Tofino Brewing Co. offers a variety of flavorful beers, including a seasonal umami-rich option and easy-drinking session ales like crisp blondes, toasty coppers, and citrusy IPAs. These refreshing beverages are perfect for quenching your thirst after a session of surfing in the cold Pacific waves. You can try them all by ordering a tasting flight at the brewery and take home your favorite in one of their attractive brown glass growlers.
name: Tofino Brewing Co
address: 691 Industrial Way, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

detail_description: Paddle West Kayaking is your go-to destination for an unforgettable kayaking adventure in Tofino. They offer a variety of trips, ranging from 2.5 hours to longer excursions that can include lodge stays or wilderness camping, catering to both beginners and seasoned paddlers alike. Located conveniently near Jaimie's Whaling Station, Paddle West provides all the necessary gear including kayaks and life jackets.
name: Paddle West Kayaking
address: 606 Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R 3A0, Canada

detail_description: Tla-o-qui-aht Economic Development Corp is introducing the West Coast Floating Sauna Experience, set to debut in February. The journey begins with a 25-minute boat ride from Tofino Resort + Marina's Marine Adventure Centre to a secluded area within the Tla-o-qui-aht First Nation's territory. During the boat ride, guests may have the opportunity to observe black bears and baby sea otters along the shoreline, creating an immersive coastal safari experience.
name: Tla-o-qui-aht Development Corporation
address: 1119 Pacific Rim Hwy Building B, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

excerpt: All-suite resort with beach houses & ocean views, plus beachside dining & free seasonal kids' club.
detail_description: Pacific Sands Beach Resort is a beachfront all-suite hotel that offers stunning ocean views and beach houses. It is situated on Cox Bay, adjacent to Pacific Rim National Park Reserve, and is just a short drive from Long Beach and Tofino's seaside village center. The resort provides family-friendly accommodations ranging from studios to three-bedroom Beach Houses, all equipped with fully-equipped kitchens and cozy fireplaces. Guests can enjoy beachside dining as well as access to a seasonal kids' club.
name: Pacific Sands Beach Resort
address: 1421 Pacific Rim Hwy, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

excerpt: Straightforward quarters, a diner & a marina in a vibrant resort set along the coastline.
detail_description: The Tofino Resort + Marina is a vibrant and lively resort located along the coastline, offering straightforward accommodations. The hotel seamlessly combines the rich traditions and artwork of the Tla-o-qui-aht First Nation with modern culinary creativity found in restaurants like 1909 Kitchen and Wolf in the Fog. This destination is perfect for outdoor enthusiasts, as it offers activities such as fishing, hiking, surfing, and stand-up paddleboarding.
name: Tofino Resort + Marina
address: 634 Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

detail_description: The Clayoquot Wilderness Lodge, an esteemed luxury retreat nestled along the banks of Clayoquot Sound in Vancouver Islands, provides a serene and idyllic setting to experience Canada's remote and unspoiled wilderness. Accessible solely by boat or seaplane, the journey to this remarkable venue signifies a true departure from everyday life. Surrounded by majestic conifer forests, the lodge offers guests an unforgettable opportunity to immerse themselves in the breathtaking landscape and observe its diverse wildlife.
name: Clayoquot Sound Theatre
address: 380 Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

excerpt: This funky, locally-sourced-seafood shack with minimal seating is popular for its fish ’n’ chips.
detail_description: Wildside Grill is a popular spot in Tofino, known for its locally sourced seafood and burgers. Despite its small size and outdoor-only seating, the shack offers a diverse menu, including breakfast tacos, huevos rancheros, oysters, and free-range chicken burgers. The owners are also set to open Surfside Grill at the nearby Pacific Sands Beach Resort. This new concept will feature dishes like seafood gumbo, prawn burgers, and oysters.
name: Wildside Grill
address: 1180 BC-4, Tofino, BC V0R 3A0, Canada

detail_description: Surf Sister Surf School, located in Tofino, offers surfing lessons and equipment rentals for all levels of experience. The school has a team of experienced female instructors who ensure a safe and enjoyable learning environment for beginners while also providing guidance for more advanced surfers. Established in 1993, the school is committed to empowering women through ethical initiatives. They offer comprehensive group lessons, private lessons, and surfing camps for both youth and adults.
name: Surf Sister Surf School
address: 625 Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R 3A0, Canada

excerpt: Upscale, rustic lodge offering cozy, country-style rooms, plus free breakfast & a private beach.
detail_description: Middle Beach Lodge is an elegant, country-themed lodge that offers comfortable accommodations. With its rustic charm and cozy rooms, it provides a tranquil and idyllic setting for couples seeking a romantic getaway. On rainy days, guests can enjoy the warmth of a large stone fireplace while indulging in freshly-baked cookies. Alternatively, they can bask in the sunshine on the outdoor deck, which overlooks the ocean and offers access to a beautiful beach via a set of stairs.
name: Middle Beach Lodge
address: 400 MacKenzie Beach Rd, Tofino, BC V0R 3A0, Canada

name: Pacific Surf School
address: 441 Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R 3A0, Canada

detail_description: The Tofino Surf Shop, known as Storm Surf Shop, is a well-established store in Tofino that specializes in surfing equipment and apparel. They offer a wide selection of locally shaped surfboards, gear for stand-up paddleboarding (SUP), surfboard rentals, and surf lessons. Located at 444 Campbell St., Storm Surf Shop has been serving the surfing community for a long time.
name: Storm | The Tofino Surf Shop
address: 444 Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

detail_description: During a recent trip to Tofino, I stumbled upon Merge, a charming store that showcases an array of Canadian-made products including clothing, home decorations, and self-care items. The shop's vibrant pink exterior is truly eye-catching and definitely worth a visit. Merge offers a delightful selection of unique trinkets and gift ideas, albeit with slightly higher price points. However, the quality of the merchandise is exceptional.
name: Merge
address: Pink building in the alley, 305-B Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

name: Long Beach Market
address: 921 Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R, Canada

excerpt: Elegant oceanfront lodging with balconies & fireplaces, plus an elegant restaurant/bar & a spa.
detail_description: The Wickaninnish Inn, a renowned lodge in Tofino, has been providing a luxurious coastal wilderness experience since 1996. The 72 elegant accommodations offer various options, from cozy standard rooms with fireplaces and private balconies showcasing breathtaking ocean views to larger suites with extra living space and bigger balconies. Its magnificent location on Vancouver Island's rugged west coast is surrounded by the Pacific Ocean on three sides and backed by an ancient forest.
name: Wickaninnish Inn
address: 500 Osprey Ln, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

excerpt: Simple campsite offering showers, Wi-Fi, laundry facilities & firewood in a scenic seaside setting.
detail_description: Bella Pacifica Campground is a private campground located in the Tofino area, offering various amenities such as showers, Wi-Fi, laundry facilities, and firewood. Situated on picturesque Mackenzie Beach, this campsite provides different types of sites including oceanside, beachfront, and forest sites that cater to different preferences for privacy and service level. The beachfront sites may lack seclusion but compensate with unobstructed views of the surf.
name: Bella Pacifica Campground
address: 400 MacKenzie Beach Rd, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

excerpt: Inventive homemade chocolates & gelato are sold in this quaint, shacklike shop with outdoor seats.
detail_description: Chocolate Tofino is a charming and rustic shop that offers unique homemade chocolates and gelato. It is renowned for its delectable desserts, particularly the handcrafted chocolates with their exquisite designs and flavors. What sets this chocolatier apart is its commitment to using sustainable cocoa in all its products. The owners, Kim and Cam Shaw, take great pride in sourcing the best ingredients available to create their treats.
name: Chocolate Tofino
address: 1180A Pacific Rim Hwy, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

excerpt: Upscale bar/eatery with water views & warm decor serving farm-fresh Canadian dishes & Sunday brunch.
detail_description: The Pointe Restaurant is an elegant bar and eatery in Tofino, Canada, offering beautiful water views and warm decor. It has been serving farm-fresh Canadian dishes for 15 years. The restaurant is known for its gourmet focus and is located at the Wickaninnish Inn, a luxurious hotel overlooking the Pacific Ocean. Guests can enjoy dishes like local cod with romesco crumble or aged organic ribeye with mashed Yukon Gold potatoes.
name: The Pointe Restaurant
address: 500 Osprey Ln, Tofino, BC V0R 3A0, Canada

detail_description: Live To Surf Inc, established in 1984, is Tofino's original surf shop offering rentals, lessons, and sales of a wide range of surfboards suitable for novices to experts. They also provide rental SUPs. The company is located a few minutes' drive from Tofino town center. Live To Surf Inc provides an opportunity to learn surfing on Vancouver Island's rugged West Coast with safe and fun learning environment for all ages.
name: Live To Surf Inc
address: 1180 Pacific Rim Hwy, Tofino, BC V0R 3A0, Canada

detail_description: Caravan Beach Shop in Tofino is a small, charming store with a great selection of items including clothes, local photographers' prints, and unique camping equipment. The shop is known for its personal service and friendly atmosphere, offering a range of products from coffee cups to art and warm coats. Visitors appreciate the store's accommodating return policy and often leave with something special like overalls, candles, or locally made dog accessories.
name: Caravan Beach Shop
address: 346 Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R 3A0, Canada

excerpt: Celebrated seafood spot with a relaxed setting & a menu highlighting local, seasonal ingredients.
detail_description: SoBo Restaurant is a renowned seafood spot known for its relaxed setting and menu featuring local, seasonal ingredients. It gained popularity as one of Canada's best-known eateries, starting as a small purple food truck. The restaurant offers crispy rock shrimp, cod, and halibut sourced directly from the ocean. Additionally, it houses Tacofino, which has become a destination in itself with food trucks in Vancouver, Victoria, and Kelowna.
name: SoBo Restaurant
address: 311 Neill St, Tofino, BC V0R 3A0, Canada

detail_description: Pacific Rim National Park Reserve - Long Beach Unit is a coastal retreat perfect for nature lovers. The area offers endless stretches of beach, attracting surfers and those seeking to admire the waves or walk along the sand. In addition to the beach, visitors can explore old-growth forests and camp along the oceanfront, providing stunning coastal scenery in British Columbia.
name: Pacific Rim National Park Reserve - Long Beach Unit
address: Ucluelet, BC V0R 3A0, Canada

excerpt: Wood boardwalk & gravel trail through a forest of cedar & hemlock trees hung with mosses.
detail_description: The Rainforest Trail offers a serene stroll through a lush forest of cedar and hemlock trees adorned with mosses. This well-maintained boardwalk trail, located between Ucluelet and Tofino, features two loops on either side of the highway. It's an easy hike suitable for all ages, with wooden stairs winding through the enchanting old-growth forests.
name: Rainforest Trail
address: Rainforest Trail - Trail B, Ucluelet, BC V0R 3A0, Canada

excerpt: Natural coastal park overlooking the sound with a sandy beach backed by forest & viewing platform.
detail_description: Tonquin Park is a natural coastal park in Tofino, offering stunning views of the sound and featuring a sandy beach surrounded by forest. The park includes several popular activity and sightseeing destinations such as Long Beach, Rainforest Trail, and Maquinna Marine Provincial Park. One of its highlights is the Tonquin Park trail, which takes hikers through old-growth forest to Tonquin Beach, Third Beach, and Middle Beach.
name: Tonquin Park
address: Tonquin Trail, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

detail_description: Radar Hill is a hidden gem that offers a delightful escape into nature, perfect for travelers of all ages. While remnants of the WWII radar station may be scarce, the short hike to its summit rewards visitors with breathtaking panoramic views of the ocean, inlet, and surrounding mountains. The journey begins at one of two parking lots; if the first is full, simply head to the second lot for an easy trek up.
name: Radar Hill
address: Alberni-Clayoquot, BC V0R 3A0, Canada

detail_description: Big Tree Trail, originally constructed in 1984 during logging protests on Meares Island, offers a 3-kilometer round-trip hike through ancient Western Redcedar trees, some as old as 1,500 years. The trail features a mix of boardwalk and natural paths with minimal elevation gains. Accessible by a quick ferry ride from Tofino, the trail is suitable for various fitness levels and provides stunning views of the lush surroundings.
name: Big Tree Trail
address: Meares Island, Opitsat, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

detail_description: The Wild Side Trail is an 11km one-way route with minimal elevation gain, located on the West Coast of Vancouver Island. It is snow-free almost all year round and operates from May to October. The trail features 3 designated campsites and requires a $15 permit fee along with a $10 per person, per night camping fee.
name: Wild Side Trail
address: Unnamed Road, BC V0R, Canada, Canada

detail_description: The Canso Plane Crash Site in Pacific Rim National Park is a popular hiking destination with a historical significance. In 1945, a Royal Canadian Air Force Canso 11007 crashed shortly after takeoff, and the 12 survivors were rescued after 11 hours. The site features an abandoned military building along the trail and can be accessed from a parking lot near Radar Hill.
name: Canso Plane Crash Site
address: Alberni-Clayoquot C, BC V0R 3A0, Canada

detail_description: It's impressive that nearly every town and city on Vancouver Island has its own museum, including Tofino. The Tofino-Clayoquot Heritage Museum may be small, but it is cozy and filled with a variety of fascinating artifacts and stunning photographs. Situated in Downtown Tofino, this museum offers a rich collection of displays that tell the story of the region.
name: Tofino Clayoquot Heritage Museum
address: 331 Main St, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

excerpt: Sweeping sandy beach on national park reserve edge & a surfing hot spot with camping & picnic areas.
detail_description: Long Beach, situated in the untamed Pacific Rim National Park Reserve, is renowned for its expansive sandy shoreline and as a prime destination for surfing enthusiasts. The area attracts a multitude of outdoor enthusiasts seeking to revel in the natural beauty of the Pacific Ocean. Nels Bight, located in the northwestern Vancouver Island region, is hailed as one of British Columbia's premier beaches and can only be accessed by boat or a 30-kilometer round-trip hike.
name: Long Beach
address: Alberni-Clayoquot, BC, Canada

detail_description: The Jeremy Koreski Gallery in Tofino offers a remarkable collection of artwork, particularly photography. It is a popular destination for art enthusiasts seeking to explore the beauty and essence of Tofino through visual representations. Other notable galleries in the area include The Village Gallery and the Tofino Gallery of Contemporary Art. For those interested in Tofino photography, the Roy Henry Vickers Gallery and Eagle Aerie Gallery showcase stunning pieces both inside and on their exteriors.
name: Jeremy Koreski Gallery
address: 440 Campbell St, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

detail_description: Mark Hobson Gallery is a must-visit for art enthusiasts, showcasing realistic depictions of the West Coast in stunning paintings. The gallery also features captivating photography by Jeremy Koreski and Kyler Vos, offering a deep dive into the surrounding landscape's force and beauty. Visitors can explore rotating exhibits from local talent at Henry Nolla Gallery and Carving Shed. Additionally, the gallery offers an array of art cards, blocks, and main art pieces for browsing.
name: Mark Hobson Gallery
address: 366 Campbell St #2, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada

detail_description: Combers Beach is a hidden gem that requires a bit of walking through wind-worn trees, making it less crowded with only surfers and some locals. The beach offers a wide open space with a creek to the left and a rocky outcrop to the right, providing stunning views of the west coast wildlife. While the walk from public parking may be steep for some, it's well worth it. Visitors are advised to check the tidal chart and visit at low tide for the full effect.
name: Combers Beach
address: Alberni-Clayoquot, BC, Canada

detail_description: The Tofino Gallery of Contemporary Art is a must-visit for art enthusiasts, showcasing an impressive selection of artwork. From the Jeremy Koreski Gallery to The Village Gallery, visitors can explore a variety of captivating pieces. For those interested in Tofino photography, the Roy Henry Vickers Gallery and the Eagle Aerie Gallery are worth checking out.
name: Tofino Gallery Contemporary Art
address: 430 Campbell St #105, Tofino, BC V0R 2Z0, Canada
